messages: 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:55): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: I'm testing XAudioJS on a fork of the JS GBC emulator. :)
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:55): So far mozAudio works
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:55): I'm fixing the remaining bugs
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:55): to get webAudio and the data uri fallback working
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:55): http://www 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2alitz.org/test/gameboy/
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:56): yo dawg, the code is currently at http://www 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2alitz.org/test/gameboy/js/other/XAudioServer.js
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (03:57): either of you know if a div can have a lower z-index than <body> and appear below a bg attached to the body?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (03:57): or is body kind of the bottom of the stack for good?
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:59): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: I'm trying to fix the bugs right now, should be done by tonight for a git upload.
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:04): I need to re-add the audio resampler for web audio
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:04): which resamples the audio in real-time for compat with web audio for when sample rate in != hardware sample rate detected by web audio
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:07): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: I'll have to document how to initialize and run the XAudioServer object
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:07): It does all the behind-the-scenes magic for you
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:08): and wraps mozAudio, web audio, and even the WAV PCM data uri fallback in it
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:08): all you need to do is access its write function, initialize it properly, and provide an audio underflow callback
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:10): so you don't need to know squat about moz audio or web audio to output audio in your browser. :)
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:10): all you need to know is the XAudioServer API.

be2db18d09c0b366b3239eeb8b3b2dde (04:20): it doesn't take a very big video to break the data uri :P

be2db18d09c0b366b3239eeb8b3b2dde (04:21): with rssowl I can use many websites at the same time. Some one should call mozilla.

dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:39): i just want to confirm that this is somewhat insane <footer id="footer">
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:39): or <header id="header">
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:42): it allows to attach js to them, and differentiates as you can have many headers and footers in a page
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:42): seems weird to me although i get the point about JS
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:43): the way i was seeing it used was with a single header and footer on the page and no JS referencing it
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:43): geuss im not up to speed on html5 semantics yet
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:43): <section> and <article> confuse me a bit as well
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:43): articles can have their own header and footer too
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:44): if you want to get uptospeed with the semantic stuff, this is a good site http://html5doctor.com/

0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:45): "We will publish articles relating to HTML5, its semantics, and how to use it right now. We also invite questions via Ask the Doctor. We‚Äôll post answers in future articles so that everyone can benefit."
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:50): any major cons to using html5shiv ?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:50): given that it pretty much just allows styleability to old browsers.......no
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:50): i have done websites that have the new semantic stuff working all the way back to IE6 :D
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:51): right now im only using the html5 doctype in my sites
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:51): looking to expand that a bit
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:51): getting your toes a little wet
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:51): soon you'll go deeper and get the water past your ankles

0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:52): next thing you know, look out! you're splashing around dunking people showing off being all like "i'm all up on the new technology, while you're still making table layouts HAHAHAAHAHAHAHA"
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:53): i do find it shocking that i still run into brand new sites made entirely of tables and image maps
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:53): it's a travesty
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:53): granted last night i tried applying for unemployment, and the website mentioned the need for IE5+, cookies, and popups enabled
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:53): and the UI actually didn't do anything
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:53): lets just say i didn't end up applying
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:53): you should try using a south korean website
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:54): you cant do anything without activeX
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:54): and most everything is designed for ie6
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:54): i had to tweet about it saying "if you want me to have faith in the US government, make sure the sites actually work in modern browsers"
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:54): i mean for something like that they could even just get a template these days
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:55): the orient, from what i've seen, is going to be using IE6 for awhile yet
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (04:55): with their pirated copies of XP
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:55): specifically korea is whats the most worrying to me
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:55): they are a pretty modern country by most standards
dc05eb81266d27007774162810df8fa6 (04:55): and its not just IE ...its activeX
